SEC. 101. Extension of the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program through March 31, 2004. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925 of such Act, shall continue through March 31, 2004, in the manner authorized for fiscal year 2002. Grants and payments may be made for carrying out such activities during the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for the first two quarters of fiscal year 2002. Grants and payments may be made for activities authorized by the Social Security Act through March 31, 2004, at the level provided for the first two quarters of fiscal year 2002. Conforming amendments are made for supplemental grants in certain states. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, changing dates and fiscal years for grants and funds. Maintenance of effort requirements are also updated for fiscal years 2004 and 2005. Amendments to the Social Security Act include updating maintenance of effort requirements for fiscal years 2004 and 2005 by changing dates and fiscal years for grants and funds. Extension of the national random sample study of child welfare and child welfare waiver authority through March 31, 2004, with appropriations authorized for fiscal year 2002 activities to continue. Grants and payments can be made for activities in the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the same level as in 2002. TITLE II--TAX PROVISIONS

SEC. 201. Amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend the disclosure of return information for income contingent repayment of student loans until December 31, 2004.
